body.directions: Read each word or phrase in Chinese,and then answer the question that follows.

body.quiz: Which of the following cannot be placed after this word?
body.answer: Audio for 咖啡 kāfēi (coffee)
options: Audio for 害羞 hàixiū
Audio for 开朗 kāilǎng
Audio for 喜欢 xǐhuān
body.correct: Job well done! 最 zuì (the most) can be placed before an adjective, noun, or some verbs to indicate the superlative.
body.incorrect: Very close. Think about the meaning of this word, and recall how it can be used in a sentence.

body.quiz: Which of the following words can be used to complete this phrase?
body.correct: Awesome job! An adjective should be inserted to complete this phrase.
body.incorrect: Oops... think about what types of words can be inserted for this phrase.

body.quiz: In what situation can we use this word in a sentence?
body.answer: When we want to disagree or deny
options: When we want to express excitement
When we want to express approval
When we want to give an order
body.correct: You got it! 不 bù means “not,” and it is used in a sentence to express disagreement or denial.
body.incorrect: So close! Think about the meaning of this word and how it can be used in a sentence.

body.quiz: Which of the following is the antonym (word with opposite meaning) for this word?
body.correct: Fabulous job! 冷 lěng means “cold,” and its opposite should be 热 rè (hot).
body.incorrect: So close! Think about the meaning of this word and what its opposite adjective should be.
